page.title: 02CASTLE CALDWELL
page.content: CASTLE CALDWELL IS A FOREST AND NATURE RESERVE.THE CASTLE WAS FIRST BUILT IN 1612 BY THE BLENNERHASSET FAMILY DURING THE PLANTATION OF ULSTER.THE CALDWELL FAMILY BOUGHT IT IN 1670 THERE WERE FIVE GENERATIONS OF CALDWELLS IN CASTLE CALDWELL AND THE LAST SIR JOHN'S DAUGHTER MARRIED MAJOR BLOOMFIELD AND THEIR SON JOHN CALDWELL BLOOMFIELD WAS ONE OF THE FOUNDERS OF BELLEEK POTTERY.CASTLE CALDWELL WAS FINALLY SOLD DUE TO FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES AND EARLY THIS CENTURY WAS BOUGHT BY THE GOVERNMENT AS A STATE FOREST.AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CASTLE THERE IS A LARGE STONE FIDDLE IN REMEMBRANCE OF DENIS MC CABE,A FIDDLER WHO WAS DROWNED WHEN HE FELL FROM A BARGE DURING A PARTY.THERE ARE SOME RARE BIRDS THERE THE COMMON SCOOTER, THE BLACKCAP AND THE CORNCRAKE.THE CASTLE IS NOW A RUIN.
